**Course description:**

    This course aims to familiarize the students with the fundamental concepts of language and linguistics as well as the basic skills required for doing linguistic analysis. It is hoped that with these concepts and skills the students will be better equipped both for advanced linguistics courses and as competent language teachers/learners.

**Textbook:**

_An Introduction to Language_ (10th/11th edition), by Victoria Fromkin, Robert Rodman & Nina Hyams.

**Requirements and Evaluation**:

Quizzes  30%   (?Assignments: bonus points)

Exams   60%     

Attendance & Participation  10%

**Bonus points added to the final grade (5 points at most):**

1.  You may participate in a 2-hour linguistics workshop or conference, take notes, and **hand-write** a 200-word report to summarize what you have learned and express your opinions to get one bonus point. If the workshop/conference is 4 hours long, you should write a 400-word report to get 2 bonus points.
2.  You may participate in a 1.5/2-hour talk or listen to an on-line talk on linguistics, take notes, and **hand-write** a 200-word report to summarize what you have learned and express your opinions to get one bonus point.

**Other Requirements:**

1.  All assignments must be handed in on time. Late submission is not acceptable.
2.  **Attendance is required. If you can’t come to a class, you must email me asap; otherwise, it will cost you two points from your final grade.** If you are absent in case of uncontrollable situations (e.g., accidents, etc.), be sure to give me the valid proof within two weeks.
3.  Make-up quizzes are allowed only during the class break on that day and you can only get 70% of the scores you get in the make-up quizzes. **NO make-up exams are possible** unless you are hospitalized/quarantined or permitted in advance. You can only get 70% of the scores you get in the make-up exams unless you are hospitalized/quarantined or attend important contests for the university on the day of the exam.
4.  Grades are **NOT** negotiable.
5.  You MUST wear a mask and NO FOOD is allowed when we have the class in person.
